Reviews.Title: “A very good choice, you really get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kamela-Julian
Reviews.Content: The main reason we chose this B&B was the nearness of public transportation such as trains (to get at the airport), buses (nr 3 to the center) and trams (nr 8 to the center), so you can easily reach the main points of interest. The rooms are clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The only problem we had when we arrived, was the location of the hotel; it's located upon a small hill and you have to take some stairs to get there. But, don't worry, just ask around! Breakfast was quite good for a basic 3 star hotel; bread, jam, butter, coffee, tea, cheese and so on. We paid approx. 60 euro for a double room + breakfast and 2 euro city tax per person per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: TerezaPrague
Reviews.Content: I didn´t expected so much and I was suprised. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull. The room was basic, but very clean. After first night we moved to other room because of the noise from big road under the window, but after that it was all ok. Bad was comfort for two people and bathroom was perfect. Breakfast was better than I expected - juices, coffee or tea, chocolate...small baguettes, jams, cheese, salami and many kinds of sweet pastry. The hotel is near to railway station which goes to airport, so this is very good. To the centre you can go by bus 3 or tram 8.

Reviews.Title: “Life is what you make it...”
Reviews.Author: arisedragonlady
Reviews.Content: One has to judge this hotel keeping in mind the reasonable cost and location. The cost is EU 185 which is very reasonable but by no mean do not expect it to be a Hilton in Rome. As for location it is very close to the bus stop 3 to take you to the colosseum, the tram to Argentina to take you to the Pantheon and Campo D'fiore and regiona train to take you to the main terminal or to the airport. The location is also where the people who work in Rome live. So do not expect Beveryly Hills but an area where there is the local butcher, small market, and grand ma and grand pa around the center sitting watching their grandkids play. Authentic? Yes. Noisy, drunk, people waking up early to get to work...Yes, yes, and yes. Do not expect a suburm in US...but a real, neighborhood where a community has lived and grown up in. Now the down side of the hotel...bed was tough...but the room was bigger than what I got in Tokyo for the same price range. The room was bigger but my hotel in Tokyo was cleaner. Because of the price, it is popular to other tourists from Italy and other neighboring nations like Spain, Portugal, and Greece. It can get a bit noise from other guests and neighbors on the street. However, the front desk is very supportive to tell other guests to quiet down. They were able to tell a group of students on a tour to quiet down so I can get some sleep. Breakfast is ok but there is a pastry shop on the corner that has an amazing cappuccino. I gave this hotel a 4 because it was a palce to rest and shower and the proximity to all the transportation and the feeling that you live there with the locals and actually "live" in Rome was priceless.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, just outside center, basic rooms,basic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fmoreijn
Reviews.Content: Comparing quality to prices for hotels is difficult in Rome, especially when there is an event in the city just like when we were there last april. We we happy to have found a (basic) three star Hotel for a four/five star price, but there was the vent with the former pope and it is Rome. The hotel can be reached (coming from the center) by train, -bus and tram. You have to take some stairs to get at the hotel, but not so many as other people seem to remember in there revieuws. Breakfast is decent and basic . Rooms are clean but need (in our case) some small repairs. Personell is very friendly and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid Avoid”
Reviews.Author: likes2watch
Reviews.Content: Air conditioners in several rooms did not work. They moved our group from room to room several times, air conditioners all sucked. Area around hotel littered with beer bottles and hypodermic needles. Lobby is nice, rooms aren't. If you really dislike someone, tell them to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, friends!”
Reviews.Author: flaviasaretta
Reviews.Content: If it were not for the stairs... I loved my stay here. Pamela and Steban were friendly and helpful when my purse was stolen at Trastevere train station. The room was tiny, but clean and with a comfy bed after long walks in the city. And breakfast was plentiful. The neighborhood is worth seeing. I'll never forget these days. Thank you again!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in Trastevere area”
Reviews.Author: doljaks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Villa Rosa hotel for 10 days at the end of February 2011 with my working collegues, as we partecipated at Big Blu nautical fair at Rome fair, therefore we chose a hotel that was cheap enough for our company budget, as we got 3 doubles for single use for 48EUR/per room/per night, which was excellent for us.Breakfast included. Luckily we had a GPS, so at least we made it to the hotel which is in a tiny street up to the Circovallazione Gianincolense and very close to Trastevere train station and also cable trains passed by there. The staff at the reception was really handy.The double rooms were actually really tiny, but since were used as single, it was just enough.Rooms were cleaned daily which was great.Breakfast was regular, you could drink as many coffees as you wanted, eat as many croissants you wished.But after 10 days of same food we were a bit fed up. In the night the below main street was a bit noisy as there was an ambulance statoin up the street.Since we traveled with a van, we parked it in a guarded parking lot about 400mtr from the hotel on that main street...25 EUR at night, but at least we knew our vehicle was safe. All in all Villa Rosa was a cozy choice for us, who had to travel to Rome fair every day (close to highway connections to Fiumicino) and not very far from city centre (about 15 min with bus, which costs 1 EUR single). I would reccomend this hotel for a budget traveller, but if you're looking for luxury, don't go there.Last thing.If you wish to have wireless internet you need to pay for a password, which costs 5 EUR for 2 hours and 10 EUR for 5 hours, so think if you really need all that internet surfing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RomeijnLand
Reviews.Content: Villa Rosa Hotel is a nice hotel, located pretty close to the center of Rome, which makes it easy to visit a lot of the famous sites in Rome. The only slight problem about the location is that the hotel is located upon a hill, which could make reaching the hotel a bit more difficult for some people. The staff is friendly and very trustworthy. On the day I was chcking out of the hotel, I accidentally left my watch in my room. I had left my luggage at the hotel to do a bit more sightseeing, and when I came to take my luggage, the staff returned my watch to me. The rooms are quite simple, but very good nonetheless. Below the hill that the hotel is on, there is a road, so there might be traffic driving around, but this didn't really cause much noise, at least not so much that it bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Kay W
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel because we wanted to stay in the area of Trastevere which we heard would be a real 'Roman experience'. Unfortunately the hotel was not actually in the centre of Trastevere and was infact over a 20 minute walk to get there. The area which the hotel was in wasn't particularly nice, the only good thing I would say is that it is very close to the train station. The reception area of the hotel was very nice and clean but the hotel staff member who served us wasn't very friendly although he did tell us a little place we could eat which was very nice. The room we stayed in was a double room but wasn't very big at all. The walls were dirty and they had big cracks in too. The bathroom was very small but it was clean and seemed quite new unlike the room. Breakfast in the morning was included in the price but was very basic and not particularly interesting or tasty. Overall for our first trip to Rome the hotel served its purpose, it gave us a roof over our heads but knowing Rome a bit better now if we were to return then we wouldn't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok ... for a very short trip”
Reviews.Author: kleintje78
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to us by an Italian friend. We booked a 'double economy' room and paid Eur 60 per night up-front. Our friend also booked the same room type but didn't pay up front. We were given the tiniest room you could imagine and he was given a room of normal size. I asked to upgrade and was shown a normal sized room for Eur 70 a night and this was perfectly fine, with a normal sized bed and bathroom (but in the end we stayed in the small room). My advice is pay the Eur 10 extra for your sanity. I am used to staying in small and basic rooms but, for four days, this was pretty unbearable. There was approximately 1 meter square of free space that was not taken up by bed or furniture. There was no space to put our two large bags and it was impossible for two people to be standing up in the room at one time. I am not joking; it was really *that* small. Beware too, of the bed. It's really a large single and, if you are of large body build, you will not be able to get into the shower. The heating also made dripping and clanging sounds all night (which won't be a problem if you are there in the summer). On the positive side, the place was clean and the staff friendly. The normal sized rooms seemed like good value - just don't pay until you get there. Once they have your money, you'll be shoved into the worst room. It's pretty far from any attractions and from the centre of Trasevere but the tram stop is located 50 meters from the hotel so it's quite convenient. The tram stops around midnight though, so you'll have to fork out for a taxi if you're out late.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty - don't book here unless you absolutely must”
Reviews.Author: Travel_velocity
Reviews.Content: To begin, this is not a three star hotel. The hotel is located adjacent to a major road so you will hear ambulances and motorbikes and cars at all hours of the night. The rooms are dirty and the carpets in the halls are in serious need to replacing (dirt is ground in). The breakfast should be skipped. It is not worth the money to stay here. Go elsewhere. I had no choice as there was a U2 concert where concert goers filled all the usual hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient hotel in 'real Rome'”
Reviews.Author: jmandk
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Rome and we decided to stay in a slightly more authentic part of Rome away from the centre of tourism, This Hotel was ideal, situated as it is very close to a tram station which took us the short distance to the centre of the city. The Hotel is clean and efficient... the reception/common area and dining room being positively gleaming! Our room was quite basic but perfectly comfortable. Breakfast adequate. Trastevere in itself is full of life with numerous busy restaurants and a great atmosphere at night with locals as well as tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: tezzauno
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through last minute.com and was expecting the hotel and it's rooms to be just as they were on their website. I opened the door to our quad room to find that the room was in fact NOTHING and i reall mean NOTHING like the ones i'd seen on the website, our room was covered in green formica panelling , the walls were absolutely filthy, a cabinet had been mended using big screws that were sticking out, a large peice of wood located above the bathroom window was falling off and balancing on the window itself so i could not open or close it as the wood would have fallen off completely. The walls and ceiling had several stains from leaks from above. The bidet did not work at all, the sink taps worked so slowly that if you decided to wash in the sink (which none of us chose to) you would have to wait for it to fill up. The shower had a dial missing from the centre and there was mould (quite a lot) around the bottom and most of the sealant was peeling off, odd tiles had been replaced very badly and the whole shower looked very very poor. We did not use the shower as it was so disgusting so i do not know if it was actually working or not. I asked at reception to be moved to the room that i had booked and was told that the hotel was full and there was no manager available until the next day. I was up and out of the hotel early the next day so did not get to speak to the manager which is probably a good thing ( for the manager i mean) The reception and dining room are just as they are on the website but where are these lovely rooms for sleeping in? I certainly didn't see them. Good luck if you have booked.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from the center, tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ruigo
Reviews.Content: The room was so small that we had to dress ourselves one a a time! Far away from the main atractions. Always had to go by bus or train. Average breakfast. Not very expensive thow...

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ton_amie
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel while in Rome. We found the rooms to be inviting, clean, and comfortable. Good city location (although a bit traffic noise at night) ,and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Really good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonHoward
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Rosa Hotel Sept 08 and found it was excellent value for the price we paid. The room was a good size, nice bathroom. Breakfast was fine and the staff were very helpful and courteous. Excellent location to get into the centre of Rome. Regular bus/train routes opposite the hotel. Try to book a room at the back of the hotel as the hotel is very near to a busy and noisy main road. We would not hesiate to go back to the Villa Rosa if we ever decided to re-visit Rome again in the future. Sheena Day & Vida Corcoran London, England

Reviews.Title: “Yikes...”
Reviews.Author: katelina1
Reviews.Content: We decided to choose a three star hotel slightly outside of the main tourist areas in Rome because we figured we'd get more for the money - boy were we wrong! It was so far out of the city that no one at the train station (information desk, hotel desk, bus drivers, etc) knew where it was, and we ended up having to get a cab (which are expensive!). The hotel looked nice in the lobby, but the rooms looked NOTHING like the photos on their website - it was so small that we barely had enough room to open our luggage. The bathroom was tiny, and we didn't have hot water for the first three days. The floors in the bathroom were peeling up around the shower, and there was mold in the shower and on the wall. It also looked as though they had removed a tile, though god knows what they replaced it with because it looked like some sort of growth coming out of the wall. It was really difficult to shower there! The ONLY positive of this hotel was that it's near the Trastevere district, which is known for it's restaurants and nightlife. It was a short trolley ride to get there. Otherwise, this place was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice: Friendly, Clean and reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: CowsGoMooo
Reviews.Content: On the whole this was a really great litte hotel. It was clean, the staff were friendly and were only to pleased to help out with directions, requests etc. The walls did seem a little thin and you can hear the louder guests now and again. It is of the main drag a little and on arriving you do get the feeling that one is in the middle of nowhere, there are few tourists here. Theres a tram stop less than a minute away which will take you to the heart of the city. Also a bus stop to take you to Termni station too. Try the dinner in the hotel. Its nice and really cheap up the site of other Roman prices! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “all fine, handy location”
Reviews.Author: MTL1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. This was the cheapest place available in Rome, apart from some cheap shared bathroom accommodation near Termini. Paid 95 EUr for a double. The room was fine, we had asked for a room at the back and it was really quiet. The location of the hotel is very practical- getting to the airport is really easy with Trastever station a 3 min walk away and teh tram takes you directly to the centro storico. Didn't try the breakfast as i prefer to have coffee in a bar, like most Italians. Staff was very friendly and helpful- we left our luggage for a few hours on the day of departure which was no problem. Overall i was pleased and i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalteserNaxxar
Reviews.Content: We have just come from a short visit to Rome and loved the Hotel Villa Rosa. It was absolutely clean towels, sheets and all. The staff were very helpful and all spoke good english. Breakfast was good but could have been alittle more varied. But on the whole it was a good stay and we will surely return to it. Couple from Malta

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenmar49
Reviews.Content: This place is OK. The room we had was 2 single beds, and too small for them, we had to move them apart for actual sleeping. The shower would have been a squeeze for someone of more generous dimensions. The aircon was fine, and needed to be as our room overlooked Giancolense, where emergency vehicles seemed to be up and down a lot.......The reception staff were really helpful, and we thought the transport into the centre was good. Didn't try local restaurants though. The breakfasts were only ok. Fresh juice would seem to be too hard....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: WixEngland
Reviews.Content: Having seen previous reviews of this hotel, I was fearing the worst. No need. The hotel is clean, bright, fresh and appealing. The staff were friendly and helpful and more than willing to point you in the right direction to good restaurants/public transport and off the beaten track places of interest. The breakfast was excellent and the waiting staff were willing to bring anything you required. The linen and towels are changed daily and the chambermaids were kind and friendly. The rooms are quite small and, if you're at the front of the hotel, can be quite noisy. Just ask for a room at the back and you'll get one if it's available. Would I stay there again? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: sydsyd99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is something of a mixed bag, but overall quite satisfactory and so long as the issues described below are not a problem for a particular guest, we'd recommend this hotel. (We stayed here on 2 separate occasions in the space of a week.) Our first room was OK; bathroom was excellent. However, one of the 2 single matresses combined to make our double bed felt like it had been used as a chariot speed bump at Circus Maximus. Our second room was very nice, as was bathroom. Matresses were fine. The staff were friendly and attentive and accommodated a couple of special requests we made. Very happy. Of the 3 European hotels we stayed in, this one had by far the best breakfast. On both occasions, we could not get the airconditioning to cool. It was heating or nothing. Reception told us that all the airconditioners in the hotel were set to the same setting and that a technician needed to come out to switch them over from winter to summer settings. This is a bit of a problem if the weather turns unseasonally warm, as happened in our case. Evening breezes provided substantial relief, except this let all the street noise (esp sirens!) in. The location is great in terms of convenient access to the airport by train. Not only is Trastevere closer to the airport, but the hotel is walking distance to Trastevere station. Indeed, once we knew where the hotel was, we were, save for a testing street staircase, comfortably able to walk to the station carrying all our luggage. However, in terms of seeing the sights of Rome on the eastern side of the river, the location is poor. At a glance, the rail options look good on a map. But, in fact, getting to those sights by rail/metro, and especially returning in the evening, is at best very cumbersome and at worst a nightmare. From Termini, the H bus might even be a better bet outside of peak hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ofer_Edelstein
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 days stay at VILLA Rosa-Rome. Location- Aprox. 250 meters from the Tarstevere station, it's important when a taxi from the airport costs 50 E. (only 5.5 E by train). Aprox. 100 meters from Tram 8 and major bus lines. A bit noisy at night (try to ask for rooms at the back). The hotel is located at the Trastevere area, graet atmosphere at night. Rooms- rather small but clean, smelled good, fresh tools and sheets every day. Hey, you are in Rome, how cares about the room size?. We had a bit of a problem mattress but I really can't compare it to my home mattress. Breakfast- In Israeli standards, it was pretty lame, but we knew it before ordering. It wouldn't kill them to provide Yogurt and some cheese too. Rome offers you breakfasts for 5.5 E each and good ones. Staff- friendly, friendly and again friendly. All most every one of them speak English well (especially the ladies). We fill obligated to mark the two reception desk ladies (we apologize for forgetting their names). Their directions were right to the spot; they recommended on very good and authentic restaurants and actually made our visit at Rome better one!!! To sum up our experience, the hotel is 3 stars rated and we got a full money value for the money we spent. Would I recommend that hotel to my brother? Yes I would, but only because I love my bother. Would I stay there again? SURE.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: gabeszka
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our short vacation from Rome. We spent 3 nights at Villa Rosa and have to say, it was one of the worst experiance in my life staying in this hotel! The rooms were more or less Ok - 3 stars category, clean, but the staff! Unbelievable! The scruffy receptionist by check in was so rude, did not give us any registration form to fill in. As it cleared up later, he filled in these formes and signed, FAKED our names on the formes. What kind of method is it? By complains the female front office manager was also so unpolite, talked to us so loud and threated us by the police... Unbeliviable! I promised them not to offer this hotel to anyone! So, if you dear traveller would like to spend nice days in Rome do not visit this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull stay”
Reviews.Author: Spoons08
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Villa Rosa hotel before reading the posted message "Villa Nightmare". I have to say I don't understand what some people want for there money! The hotel was clean efficient and the staff were friendly and definately no bad smells! A Good breakfast was provided and parking (although limited was fine). I was staying with three friends who all had clean rooms,not massive but with subtle decoration and fresh bed linen and towels daily and most important powerfull showers. I couldn't find any walls with anti climb paint and the wall outside the hotel where you were most likely to sit was completly clear. The only criticism if any would be that if you get a front room you can here the traffic but even that's not too loud and lets face it your in Rome!I think for a budget hotel you couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Villa Rosa”
Reviews.Author: ptofview
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Villa Rosa very much. Though small, my room was comfortable and quite clean. Fresh linens arrived daily with the maid service. The hotel staff seemed pleasant, and the group I was traveling with was especially fond of the waiter in the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “NOT nightmare at Villa Rosa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at Villa Rosa hotel in Rome in august and can absoltely not agree with the americans who called their stay a nightmare. The price was acceptable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If we asked for something and they couldn't answer they called and got infomation. The airconditon worked and we got new towles every day! If we go back to Rome we will stay at Villa Rosa again. From Norway.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Rosa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giovanni Prati 1, 00152 Rome, Italy
